Exaggerate: The claim suggests that Sir David Attenborough praises the eco-friendly hotel in Singapore, but there is no evidence to support this. The Facebook page disseminating the claim is not verified to be Sir David Attenborough's, and his representative has stated that he does not have any social media accounts other than his verified Instagram account.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support its assertion that the hotel is the first to produce its own electricity with the same waste from the same building. The hotel's marketing and social media manager has stated that this statement is not factual.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the hotel is not the first to produce its own electricity with the same waste from the same building, as confirmed by the hotel's marketing and social media manager.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Sir David Attenborough has praised the eco-friendly hotel in Singapore, but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any faltering bias in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of any alternative explanation bias in the claim.
